events.originalText: After being boarded by Canadian authorities, MV Sun Sea docked in British Columbia and the 492 Sri Lankan Tamil refugee claimants on board were placed into detention.
events.subtitle: MV Sun Sea incident
events.headline: MV Sun Sea with 492 Sri Lankan Tamil refugees docks in British Columbia

events.originalText: Hurricane Charley struck the U.S. state of Florida, just 22 hours after Tropical Storm Bonnie inflicted its own damage to the region.
events.subtitle: Hurricane Charley
events.headline: Hurricane Charley hits Florida following Tropical Storm Bonnie

events.originalText: The Act on National Flag and Anthem was adopted, formally establishing the Hinomaru  and "Kimigayo" as the Japanese national flag and anthem, respectively.
events.subtitle: Act on National Flag and Anthem
events.headline: Japanese national flag and anthem officially established

events.originalText: Opha May Johnson (pictured) became the first woman to enlist in the United States Marine Corps.
events.subtitle: Opha May Johnson
events.headline: Opha May Johnson first woman to enlist in US Marine Corps

events.originalText: Members of the U.S. Army's all-black 25th Infantry Regiment were accused of killing a white bartender and wounding a white police officer in Brownsville, Texas, despite exculpatory evidence.
events.subtitle: 25th Infantry Regiment (United States)
events.headline: US Army's 25th Infantry Regiment accused of killing bartender

events.originalText: Spanish–American War: After a mock battle for Manila, the Spanish commander surrendered to the United States to keep the city out of the Philippine Revolutionary Army's hands.
events.subtitle: Spanish–American War
events.headline: Spanish commander surrenders to US after mock battle for Manila

events.originalText: The first Bayreuth Festival, created by Richard Wagner and his wife Cosima to showcase his stage works, was opened with Das Rheingold.
events.subtitle: Bayreuth Festival
events.headline: Bayreuth Festival opens with Das Rheingold

events.originalText: A major earthquake near Arica, Peru (now in Chile), caused an estimated 25,000 casualties; the subsequent tsunami caused considerable damage as far away as Hawaii and New Zealand.
events.subtitle: 1868 Arica earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake near Arica, Peru causes 25,000 casualties

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: Off the coast of Maine, the United States suffered its worst naval defeat until 1941.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: US suffers worst naval defeat off coast of Maine

events.originalText: Anglo-Spanish War: The United Kingdom captured Havana after a five-week siege, holding it until the Treaty of Paris the following year.
events.subtitle: Anglo-Spanish War (1762–1763)
events.headline: UK captures Havana in Anglo-Spanish War

events.originalText: War of the Spanish Succession: The Duke of Marlborough led Allied forces to a crucial victory at the Battle of Blenheim.
events.subtitle: War of the Spanish Succession
events.headline: Allies win Battle of Blenheim in War of Spanish Succession

events.originalText: General George Monck founded the predecessor to the Coldstream Guards (soldier pictured), the oldest regular regiment of the British Army in continuous active service.
events.subtitle: George Monck, 1st Duke of Albemarle
events.headline: General George Monck founds Coldstream Guards

events.originalText: Maurice was crowned Byzantine emperor to succeed Tiberius II Constantine.
events.subtitle: Maurice (emperor)
events.headline: Maurice crowned Byzantine emperor
